Class BoardView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.VBox
com.battleship.views.BoardView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class BoardView extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox
Visual representation of a Battleship board.

This class belongs to the View layer in the MVC architecture. It is responsible for rendering the board grid, row/column headers, and (optionally) ship sprites. It does not contain any game logic.

The internal layout uses a GridPane:

  • Row 0 and column 0 are reserved for headers (A–J and 1–10).
  • Actual playable cells are placed from (col + 1, row + 1).

Ship images are drawn as a single ImageView spanning multiple cells rather than repeating the same image in each cell.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardView

      public BoardView(String title)
      Creates a new board view with a title.
      Parameters:
      title - the board title (e.g., "My Fleet" or "Enemy Waters")

  • Method Details

    • getCell

      public CellView getCell(int row, int col)
      Returns the CellView at the given board coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - row index (0–9)
      col - column index (0–9)
      Returns:
      the cell at (row, col), or null if coordinates are out of bounds

    • getGridPane

      public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane getGridPane()
      Returns the underlying GridPane.

      Useful if other view components need to apply layout configuration or add additional overlays.

      Returns:
      the grid pane used by this board view

    • clearShipSprites

      public void clearShipSprites()
      Removes all ship sprite image nodes from the grid.

      This is typically called before re-rendering the board to avoid duplicated ship images.

    • addShipSprite

      public void addShipSprite(int startRow, int startCol, int length, boolean horizontal, javafx.scene.image.Image sprite)
      Adds a ship sprite to the board as a single image spanning multiple cells.

      The sprite is positioned at the starting cell and spans length cells horizontally or vertically. Because the GridPane uses row 0 and column 0 for headers, the sprite is placed at startRow + 1 and startCol + 1.

      Parameters:
      startRow - starting row in model coordinates (0–9)
      startCol - starting column in model coordinates (0–9)
      length - ship length in cells
      horizontal - true if the ship is placed horizontally; false for vertical
      sprite - image to display; if null, nothing is added
